page.title: 20Recreation in Retford
page.content: {King's Park}is less than 200ms from the town centre and affords open space,Chinese garden,tennis courts,bowling green,crazy golf course and children's play ground.The river Idle bisects the park and the canal forms it's western boundary. {Queen's Park}is not as popular but has been laid ou twith pic-nic tables and a climbing frame to encourage people to use the facility.The canal forms the eastern boundary to this park. {The Chesterfield Canal}forms a{linear} {park}through Retford and is a well used thorough fare for walkers and pleasure craft users. The favourite place of all for Class 6 at St. Swithun's school is the canal. Catching newts is the most popular sport of the boys,paddling with their dinghies is a popular activity with the girls.Both sexes enjoy fishing.
